answers.answer: When you work out you build lean muscle and that weights more than fat, so if you has high amount of lean muscle it will weigh heavier than a body with less muscle and more fat. Suggest just using a tape measure and get rid of your weight scale. From your question it seems that you have issues with carbohydrates. Some people do well with a higher protein intake to a lower carbohydrate ratio then the normal 60% carbs, 30% protein, 10% fat. Suggest eating more low fat protein sources with lower carbohydrates amounts. Hope that helped you.

question: Please help - I am desperate!  I have been to nutritionists, endocrinologist, internal med. doctor, to no avail. I cannot lose weight unless I eat 800 cals per day.  Yes, I accurately weight and measure the food.  My drs do not believe I only eat this much, but it is true.  If I eat 1200 cals, I just maintain my weight.  If I eat more than that, I gain.  I work out 6 days a week doing moderate to very intense cardio (stairmaster 45 mins level 60-110) plus weights.  I am told there is nothing wrong with me, I just have a slow metabolism. No Thyroid problems.  High Chol (take meds).  Had gestational diabetes.  Normal BS now.  I also get very fatigued and have to nap if I eat a big lunch with lots of carbs.  Dr says I just have efficient metabolism.  Please help - it's hard to live like this!!!!
title: impossible to lose weight
